ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Absolutely. A truly engaging course on classic social theories, helpful to any social scientist.

I would absolutely recommend the course to another student. It was an excellent way for me to gain a solid understanding of many of the key ideas that have been (and still are) foundational for anthropology and really the entire range of social sciences.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It actually pushed me beyond my expectation and gave me new ideas for my own project. Thank you Paul!

From this course I gained a much better understanding of the past trajectory of anthropology, and how many of these very old ideas can be (and still are) widely utilized by current researchers. It remains to be seen exactly how the content of the course will contribute to my dissertation, but I feel that I am a more capable researcher and student of anthropology after having taken this course.
